episodes.title: A sweet German couple knocked on my parents' door and changed all of our lives . . . forever.
episodes.description:
In which I reflect upon being raised in a bonafide cult. Most world religions are no longer considered cults. This is due to them listening to their members and over time, often centuries, they begin to soften their harshest teachings in order to retain membership. The cult in which I was raised is still out their. Their world-wide membership is still relatively small, and while they change their teachings as "new light" shines upon their cult-bosses, they seldom soften their teachings. They give lip-service to authorities. They fight in court for their rights to religious freedom and protected speech, and adjust their teachings from time to time, often leaving them with weirder and more grotesque scenarios that their followers must adapt to.

I speak about what children in cults are often subjected to, how they can begin to break away even while still at home, perhaps how to spot a child going through such things as cult-children are subjected to and how to help.

episodes.title: My father was shot at while giving a talk and they stopped putting windows in Kingdom Halls.
episodes.description: These are my musings about being raised in a cult.

episodes.title: How my parents were converted into a cult in the mid 1950's.
episodes.description: My musings about being raised in a cult.
